message.content:
{"id": "118780", 
"title": "Bug 118780: Set alias for columns in data set but in expression builder still shows the old column names when selecting the dataset.", 
"description": "", 
"OB": "When selecting the dataset in the expression builder, the alias name of the columns should be displayed instead of the original column name.", 
"EB": "Currently, when selecting the dataset in the expression builder, the original column names are displayed below, while the alias names are displayed above as row['column1'], for example, when double-clicking the original column name.", 
"SR": "Bug 118780: When setting aliases for columns in a dataset, the expression builder still shows the old column names when selecting the dataset. To reproduce: \n1. Create a new data source and dataset.\n2. Set an alias for the first column in the dataset, for example, 'column1'.\n3. Insert a data item that is bound to the dataset.\n4. Select the dataset in the expression builder and observe the display of column names."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '118780', 'title': 'Bug 118780Set alias for columns in data set but in expression builder still shows the old columns name when select the dataset.', 'description': '', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'In the expression builder, select the dataset and double click the first column name.Expected result:According to scr 78193 in tracker, the first column in expression build should use alias name instead of original name.Actual result:The original name of the first column was listed in the below of expression builder but the alias name appeared above as row["column1"] after double click the original name. ', 'SR': 'Bug 118780Set alias for columns in data set but in expression builder still shows the old columns name when select the dataset. Description:Set alias for columns in data set but in expression builder still shows the old columns name when select the dataset.Steps to reproduce:1. New a datasource and a dataset2. Set alias of the first column in the dataset to "column1".3. Insert a data item and bind it to dataset.4. '}
